thread.title: Civil Rights Attorney Waukeen McCoy Joins NAACP At Press Conference To Discuss $11 Million Racial Discrimination Lawsuit Against The Napa Valley Wine Train

author: cbs8
title: Civil Rights Attorney Waukeen McCoy Joins NAACP At Press Conference To Discuss $11 Million Racial Discrimination Lawsuit Against The Napa Valley Wine Train
text:
Law Offices of Waukeen McCoy ; Bob Gold & Associates
SAN FRANCISCO , Sept. 30, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- San Francisco civil rights attorney Waukeen Q. McCoy is representing the 11 women who were kicked off the Napa Valley Wine Train this past August for "being too loud." He will announce details of the group's lawsuit and be available to discuss the pending litigation.
WHO:
Civil rights attorney Waukeen McCoy
The 11 women involved in the incident
Member(s) of the NAACP
WHEN:
THURSDAY, OCT. 1
10:00a.m. PDT
WHERE:
Omni Hotel
500 California Street
(North Beach Room)
San Francisco, CA 94111
DIAL-IN:
The conference call number is (712) 832-8330
Access code: 1802773#
For more information please contact:
Bob Gold & Associates
Linda Haugsted
Linda@bobgoldpr.com
310-320-2010
To view the original version on PR Newswire, visit: http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/civil-rights-attorney-waukeen-mccoy-joins-naacp-at-press-conference-to-discuss-11-million-racial-discrimination-lawsuit-against-the-napa-valley-wine-train-300152187.html
